dialogues.text: No...no.  Thanks. He turns back to the elevator.  Susan closes the door, bu slowly; she is watching D'Angelo.  CAMERA MOVES WITH D'An as he goes to the bell of the elevator and rings it.  He remains in this position, waiting for the elevator, but n (believing himself to be alone) he leans his head against the wall and begins to weep, quietly.  Surprisingly, Susa is abruptly at his elbow, she seizes him forcibly by the arm, demanding:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taut)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's happened.  To Steve. D'Angelo, with his face contorted in grief and bitterness can no longer refuse to answer her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a broken voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the hospital...He's under arrest, too... They planted reefer cigarettes on him...in his overcoat pocket. Susan is becoming hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wildly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he...I want to go to him... D'Angelo recovers his self control.  There is force and authority in his voice as he insists:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Hunsecker, if you see him again they might...might kill him. Susan is sobered by his seriousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is "they"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask foolish questions. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your brother I'm a sensible man.  He understands only two things - power-politics and homage - tell him I came tonight to pay homage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens and Sidney steps out: He crosses the door of the apartment, pushes the button.  The bell i heard ringing inside.  While he waits, Sidney produces a handkerchief, dabs his face, straightens his tie; clearly is trying to sober up.  He goes to the bell push to ring again.  Now he notices something that had escaped him before: the door is not quite shut.  He pushes it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside.  Sidney hesitates, enters tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment appears empty.  Only one light is lit; the place is eerie.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney closes the door, goes into the main living room, CAMERA pans with him.  Something chills him, he calls softly, "J.J.?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney walks towards the study, there is nobody there eit He goes back towards the stairs to the upper floor; in do so he repasses the door of Susan's bedroom, sees that it half open, goes to look in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Sidney's viewpoint.  The bed has been slept in but i unoccupied.  The room is empty. On the seat at the foot of the bed is a drawer that has b pulled out of the wardrobe; it contains a collection of miscellaneous objects, a snapshot album, letters, souveni disarranged as if someone had been looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He looks at the empty room, disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME BEDROOM
dialogues.text: The curtains of the window onto the terrace are blowing: window is open.  Sidney walks into shot form behind CAMER He calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan? Susan steps into the room from the terrace, confronting Sidney.  She is dressed, wearing the fur coat over a skir and blouse.  Her manner is very strange; the effect of th drugs, no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney is very uncomfortable in her presence; Susan is th last person he wants to have conversation with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's J.J.? He retreats across the threshold of the bedroom, into the outer room.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: She walks forwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stands back to let her pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he called and said... Susan comes out of the bedroom, walks past CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I called... He studies the girl, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks listlessly across the room, moving like a somnambulist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. D'Angelo phoned about Steve...I went down to the hospital, but they wouldn't let me in.  He promised to keep in touch with me - Mr. D'Angelo, I mean...

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He watches her cautiously, not sure of how to deal with h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over town about Dallas... (moving towards her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP.  Susan's expression is blank; her eyes are unseeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's...unconscious... There is a tone of great despair in her voice.  Presently she recovers, CAMERA eases back to include Sidney beyond. She glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I gave Steve up... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you and J.J. do it?

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney looks at her, tensely.  Her voice is so calm, so certain that Sidney finds it difficult to play-act innoce He protests a little too loudly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie, if I get your meaning, you're pitching very wild balls. What -

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Susan interrupts, with a simplicity which is damaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother to lie, Sidney. (moving away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney decides that it is wiser not to argue.  He assumes tolerant sympathy.  He moves towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, get a good night's sleep - tomorrow's another day.  Feeling sorry for yourself won't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about Steve, not myself. I'm even sorry for my brother.  To be so lonely, without one real friend in the world - to have to hang on to a worthless rag of a girl like me because she's his only real family -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving towards her again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on now, chickie, why don't you go to bed...? Now she turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry for you, too, Sidney. You're going down with the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ship? She walks past him, still aimlessly wandering about the room; then she turns back, indicates herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS ship. She studies Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know how my brother will see you after tonight?  You'll be the man who drove his little stainless sister to suicide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaken, Sidney decides to ridicule the implied threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'll just have to smile at that. He walks past CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN
dialogues.text: Sidney walks into shot, going past her on his way to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late and I'm going home... Susan, in foreground, remains quite still, says nothing. background, Sidney slows down, his confidence failing him he looks back at her.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He can't go.  Probably, she's bluffing.  But he can't be certain.  He is suddenly angry.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He strides back towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie, whatever problems you have with J.J. - I didn't invent them! What're you blaming me for?  If you learned to let out your hatred you would be better off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Like me!  I don't choke on my own gall - I fight back!  Let THEM choke, not me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a man, Sidney, I'm -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that bit - you're a girl; you need a man to give you strength! So what do you pick such weak sisters for?  Don't you know yet that you fight fire with fire, not with tear drops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could almost forgive you if what you did to Steve came from jealousy and love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you did it for greed, Sidney - and that's pathetic. She moves past him.  He grips her, turning her around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't run away - I was always the man for you!  I'm talking to you out of two years of silence - listen to what I say!  Inside of six months -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helplessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Sidney, I can't stand this - CAMERA HOLDS Sidney and Susan in foreground.  But it is n shooting towards the door of the apartment.  A PANNING movement has included a figure at the other end of the bi room...

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: He is taking off his overcoat near the door of the apartm We don't know how long he has been there, how much he has overheard.  Without appearing to be consciously spying, Hunsecker is listening to Sidney's voice over scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over scene)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, lunatic!  All your life you've been doing penance for crimes you never committed!  I could change that, I'd teach you, I'd show you - ! CAMERA PANS round with Hunsecker who strolls across the room, making his presence known.  Sidney breaks off, drop his hands, releasing the girl.  Susan turns towards Hunse Hunsecker lays his briefcase and papers on the table.  He addresses Susan without looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to bed, Susie.  It's late... Susan makes no move.  Hunsecker glances at her, sees Sidn but treats Sidney as if he were invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing here? Susan walks towards Hunsecker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called him. Sidney moves forward also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was depressed - she heard about Dallas. Hunsecker still ignores his existence, he walks past Susa carrying his papers to the desk.  Susan turns, watching h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("controlling" his feelings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That subject it might be better not to start me on. (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's made all the papers tonight. Hunsecker studies the item in the paper.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: She is staring at her brother.  Suddenly, she is unable t suffer his authoritative air; she goes to him; he ignores her...

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER AND SUSAN
dialogues.text: Childishly, she snatches the paper from his hand, throws to the floor.  He looks at her.  Patiently, as with a hysterical infant, he stoops, recovers the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("mildly")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something you wanted to say...? (as she does not answer, continuing with growing viciousness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've put up with a lot of your guff, Susie, because you were a child.  But you're a woman now and I suspect, despite my best intentions, more than a bit of a slut...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Her head comes up sharply at the insult.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER AND SUSAN AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Hunsecker glances at Sidney, clearly reminding them of th compromising situation in which they were found.  Sidney moves to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.J., if you think -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't explain, Sidney... It doesn't matter now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose arms will I have to pry you out of next?  Not that I don't think you didn't invite it!  I know that look of yours, that pose of being wronged - and how it arouses the crusading instinct in even a Sidney Falco - Hunsecker's rising tide of brutality is having some effec on Susan, and Sidney, fearing for her, tries to intervene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to build her up, not tear her down -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (viciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you were romancing her, you mutt! (turning back to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's call it quits, my dear.  I'd like it fine if you found another home.  That means the front door is open!  Pack your things, rent a moving van and GIT! (pacing the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as for marriage, let me hit you with a few choice facts: you aren't ready for marriage!  You're incompetent - a capricious and shaky frail with a sick fatality for frail and useless men! Susan is staring sightlessly at the floor near Hunsecker' feet.  After a moment she turns and moves to the door of bedroom; her walk is a little unsteady; she goes inside, closes the door in Hunsecker's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the door closed, she leans against it as if afraid o falling.  She gropes for the door handle, finds the key a turns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsecker is studying the closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another crisis past. (walking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be fast asleep in five minutes, loaded with those headache pills...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney seems not to hear this remark.  He is concentrated the door; he moves hesitantly towards it, apprehensive. CAMERA includes Hunsecker in background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we'll get to you, Sidney. (turning to Sidney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as the column is concerned - tonight you have forfeited every ethical consideration I ever felt for you... Much more concerned with his anxiety for Susan, Sidney interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, J.J., I'll grant you anything you want. (as Hunsecker is about to interrupt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie's off her rocker tonight!  Go in and see what she's doing!  Go in and talk to her quietly - unless you want a corpse! Sidney's conviction is impressive.  But Hunsecker is unwilling to admit the danger, he continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me finish what I started to say - Seeing that Hunsecker is not taking his advice, Sidney strides swiftly to the door of Susan's bedroom.  He knock on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING TOWARDS the door.  Susan is sitting on the bed i foreground.  In a methodical, hypnotic way, she is destro the contents of the drawer, tearing letters into small fragments.  Sidney's voice is heard outside: "Susie!" Sus appears not to hear it; CAMERA TRACKS closer to her. Sidney's voice is heard again, louder: "Susie!" Susan tur sharply towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP.  Susan rises to her feet, staring at the door She begins to back away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK as Susan glances down at the record pla beside her.  She turns the knob.  We hear the clatter of record dropping and music begins.  The tune is "The Sage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT of Sidney.  He hears the music starting.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: Hunsecker has come forward.  But now, as he listens to th gramaphone record playing in the bedroom, Hunsecker relax assuming that this is a sign that Sidney's suspicions are unfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a cornball you are, Sidney... CAMERA TRACKS to include Sidney.  He does not share Hunsecker's confidence; he knocks again, calling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie! (in growing fear)

dialogues.speaker: SUSIE
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS closer to Sidney.  As he tries the doorknob CAMERA TILTS DOWN.  Sidney's hand tries the doorknob, fin it locked, shakes it forcefully.

dialogues.speaker: DETAIL
dialogues.text: From inside the bedroom.  We see the doorknob rattled.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP.  She realizes that Sidney means to insist.  S turns away towards the blowing curtains in background.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: A DETAIL SHOT.  Sidney's hand is still shaking the doorkn He releases it.  CAMERA PULLS BACK to a TWO SHOT of Sidne and Hunsecker as Sidney retreats from the door in apprehension.  Now Hunsecker has begun to share Sidney's anxiety.  He moves to the door, knocks and then pounds on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with authority)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie, this is J.J.!  Open up!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP.  She comes forward past the blowing curtains. The wind whips at her hair.  Over scene we hear the rumbl of the traffic on Broadway far below.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: He is pounding on the door again.  CAMERA makes a quick p to Sidney who, in a split second, realizes that Susan may have gone out on the balcony.  He turns, dashes towards t study to look out on the terrace.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN
dialogues.text: She has now started to climb onto the parapet.  Sidney le into shot, dragging her bodily off the parapet and out of shot.  We hear Susan cry out, a hysterical gasp.  CAMERA, looking through the windows of Susan's bedroom, sees the door fly open as Hunsecker bursts into the room.  He look swiftly around, advances towards the open window. Exasperated by the sound of the gramaphone, he switches i off; he steps out onto the terrace.  CAMERA PANS with him he turns to look back into the study where Susan's inanim figure is sprawled on the floor, half across the low upholstered footstool.  Sidney, white and shaking, is standing over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA at floor level.  Susan is framed in foreground.  T lower half of Sidney can be seen beside her.  Hunsecker i on the terrace in background.  Shocked, he moves quickly into the room.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP.  He looks down at his sister.  He is badly shaken.  The sharp bite of terror produces a reaction of something akin to anger.  But he swiftly controls it.  He moves past CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsecker stoops into shot.  Tenderly, he lifts the girl' body to get it into the arm chair.  Susan is quite lifele limp with the dead weight of a creature that has lost any instinct for self-preservation.  But as she feels her brother's arms, and as she recognizes who it is, she brea out in hysteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wildly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  NO!  Don't touch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan!... But Susan strikes at him, a vicious gesture of revulsion. Hunsecker lets her go.  She falls into the arm chair, her face hidden from him; she begins to sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her body shaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away!...Go away!... Hunsecker would like to comfort her, but he dare not touc her again for fear of inviting another rebuff.  He is dee hurt and wounded.  Embarrassed that Sidney should watch t moment, Hunsecker rises.  To cover his emotion, he walks the tray of drinks in background; he pours a brandy and comes back.  Stooping, he offers it to Susan.  Her only reaction is again to wrench herself away from him, facing the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing bitterly)

dialogues.speaker: GO AWAY
dialogues.text: Hunsecker sets down the drink, stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a choked voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to her, Sidney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to her yourself... Over scene the telephone rings.  It is ignored.  While Hunsecker looks down at the girl, helplessly, the telepho continues to ring.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP.  It is she who first becomes aware of the telephone.  Her weeping has stopped now.  Slowly, she rai her head.  CAMERA EASES BACK to include Sidney beyond her he notes this movement, seeing in it a revival of the gir will to live; he is moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The telephone is framed in foreground, Susan beyond.  It continues to ring.  As Hunsecker crosses to his desk to p up the instrument, CAMERA PULLS BACK.  Hunsecker speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuh...Yuh... (he listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute... (turning back to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie, it's Mr. D'Angelo - from the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN
dialogues.text: A CLOSE SHOT.  She raises her head higher, still weakly. see in her face a mixture of terror and hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsecker comes forward to set down the telephone in fron of her, on the footstool.  Hunsecker and Sidney watch.  S reaches a hand, which is still trembling, picks up the receiver.  Her voice as she speaks to the instrument is barely audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...yes...yes... Presently, she hangs up.  When she becomes aware that Hunsecker and Sidney are waiting for an explanation, she tells them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking with difficulty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve...is out of danger...

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: Hunsecker nods.  He already knows this.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soberly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means a lot to you?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: She does not look at him, she lowers her eyes but answers with a nod.  And then, more positively:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: He studies the girl.  His face has hardened.  He moves, beginning to pace. (And also beginning his 'manipulations

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to warn you, Susie - for your own sake - he'll still do time... CAMERA FOLLOWS Hunsecker.  It now takes in Sidney who is standing beside him.  Sidney has begun to stare fixedly a Hunsecker. (He is now realizing that Hunsecker, although has been faced with this demonstration of the girl's willingness to kill herself, has still learned nothing, i still continuing in the old pattern.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing, warming to his theme)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a hop-head - that's a felony in New York.  I can try, of course, to...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP.  Revolted, Sidney breaks in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're unholy, J.J.!  You'd rather kill this girl than let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsecker wheels on Sidney, bellowing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in blind rage)

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT OF THIS HOUSE
dialogues.text: Sidney, with equal heat, spins round to Susan, crying out before he has time to check himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impulsively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie, YOU get out of this house! - Get out before it's too late!

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney has gone too far now to pull back.  Inevitably, he continues.  During the speech, CAMERA PULLS BACK to inclu Susan and then Hunsecker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with sincerity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen with care - this will cost me everything, so you know I'm telling you the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to stop him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're incapable of the truth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (who will not by stopped)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie, there's nothing wrong with Dallas! (turning toward Hunsecker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother and I arranged it all. And if the Leslie boy is still a squooshy item in your life, forget it! - your brother arranged that one, too!  I don't usually give away presents; but this is my gift to you: Get out of here!  Leave this man! During the latter part of the speech, Susan rises slowly her feet, staring first at Sidney and then, with fearful significance, at her brother.  Hunsecker does not look at her; he is concentrated on Sidney.  Twice he has been abo to demolish Sidney, but he now stops, A THOUGHT IN HIS HE

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: He is perfectly controlled, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like most Italians, Sidney's got a big gift for dramatics.  I, however, prefer the cool and stubborn facts. Sidney has not appeared in my column in weeks - check that fact with Mary.  That leads right to another fact: Sidney had nothing to lose tonight!  To the contrary, dear - ONLY HIS OBVIOUS GREED TO

dialogues.speaker: EXPLAINS HIS ACCUSATIONS AGAINST ME
dialogues.text: In brief, BLACKMAIL! Hunsecker pauses impressively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Framing Hunsecker in foreground, Susan and Sidney beyond. Susan listens to Hunsecker objectively, with a mounting sense of his diseased reasoning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind you, not that one true fact didn't come out of Sidney's mouth tonight: self-admittedly, he committed a vicious crime of jealousy against Steve Dallas! (pausing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we have to clear Dallas, don't we?...But I'll have to sacrifice him... (he indicates Sidney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to do it. (turning to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I doing right?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: She is looking at Hunsecker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over scene)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no, Susie...? Slowly, Susan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING ACROSS Susan onto Hunsecker.  Hunsecker turns aw from her and walks to the telephone.  He picks it up and begins to speak.  While the scene continues, we hear his voice off screen, speaking to the phone, saying: "This is J.J. Hunsecker.  I want you to get a message through to Lieutenant Kello.  Ask him to ring me back.  It's urgent. Susan backs slowly away from Hunsecker.  Then she turns i CAMERA, which TRACKS with her and includes Sidney.  Susan looks at Sidney and then, ashamed, avoids his eye.  But Sidney comes nearer to her.  Susan is deeply distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sick. She looks again at Sidney.  Deliberately, Sidney nods. Susan walks toward her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan comes into the room, finding shelter from the revelation which has so appalled her.  Inexorably Sidney follows her.  He comes across the threshold, closes the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he's sick and you're the only idiot alive who didn't know it. A pause.  Sidney moves closer to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what are you going to do? There are some tears of pity in Susan's eyes.  Once more moves away from Sidney.  Sidney senses that her compassio for Hunsecker might easily lead her once again to slip ba into the trap.  He insists:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with emphasis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't owe your brother a cup of water! Another pause.  Sidney again repeats:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? She moves away from Sidney, CAMERA following her.  After moment, she answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Steve.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney is moved, having done his solitary act of chivalry To hide his feelings, he is harsh:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Pete's sake, straighten out the seams of your stockings - comb your hair - don't be so helpless all the time! CAMERA PULLS BACK to include Susan.  From the other room, hear the telephone ring.  Sidney turns and goes quickly o After a moment, Susan looks back at the door through whic Sidney has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsecker is framed in foreground, speaking into the telephone.  Sidney is in background, outside the door of Susan's bedroom.  Hunsecker is fully aware of Sidney's presence, as he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's admitted that, Harry.  My kid sister's a witness.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: A CLOSE SHOT.  He watches Hunsecker with a curious detach Producing a cigarette, he lights it and then looks up towards Hunsecker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over scene)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he admits he planted the stuff on the Dallas boy...

dialogues.speaker: RESUME HUNSECKER AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Hunsecker framed in foreground, Sidney beyond.  Hunsecker has at the same time been tapping a cigarette on the desk Sidney walks across to Hunsecker, offers the lighted matc

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: As he accepts the light he continues speaking to the phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...jealousy.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME HUNSECKER AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney turns on his heel, walking out of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He's been trying to make my sister behind my back.

dialogues.speaker: CAFE ON BROADWAY
dialogues.text: Kello is in a phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's serious, J.J.  Real reprehensible... Kello leans out of the booth into the cafe signaling thro the window to the street outside where the squad car pull ahead to a position ready for him outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'll get there.  I'm on Broadway now. Kello hangs up.  Hurries out.  We see him get into the sq car which rapidly accelerates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsecker has hung up.  He stares at the telephone for a moment.  Then he moves towards Susan's door, CAMERA TRACK with him.  He comes to the threshold, looks at Susan who standing in much the same position in which Sidney left h

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Unaware that her brother is watching her, she picks up th fur coat on the bed. (She is about to start packing her belongings.) She turns as she hears Hunsecker speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over scene)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a pretty coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING ACROSS Susan, towards Hunsecker.  Hunsecker come into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - but it's about time you had a new one. Susan turns squarely to face him.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN
dialogues.text: She braces herself to tell him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soberly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving, J.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does not sense any danger in the seriousness of her to (or, if he does, refuses to recognize it.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a faint scoff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kid a kidder.  I'll see you for breakfast around eleven. Without waiting for a response, Hunsecker goes out, closi the door.  Susan stares at it for a moment.  Then she mov to get a small suitcase which she lays on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: TERRACE
dialogues.text: Hunsecker opens the windows onto the terrace, comes out a looks over the parapet, (looking to see how far Sidney ha got, hoping to see Kello's squad car.)

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SUSAN
dialogues.text: She completes her simple packing, closing the suitcase. With a gesture that is obviously automatic, she starts to put on the fur coat; then she halts, realizing what she i doing.  She pauses; CAMERA MOVES CLOSER.  Now, deliberate she throws the coat back on the bed.  CAMERA PANS down wi the gesture.  She looks down at the coat, the discarded symbol of her dependence upon her brother.  CAMERA PULLS BACK again as she takes a quick look round, then goes to take a duffle coat from the wardrobe.  She throws this ov her arm, picks up the suitcase, goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan comes out of the door.  She moves with a sober determination, expecting to find Hunsecker in the room. CAMERA TRACKS with her.  But then she realizes that Hunse has gone out on the terrace.  She takes a step or two towards him, then pauses.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: From Susan's viewpoint, SHOOTING through the big glass windows.  Hunsecker is at the parapet.  He is impatiently looking down into Broadway.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP.  She now realizes that there is no point in saying goodbye to him: she has already told him that she leaving and, if she becomes involved in further argument with him, it can do no good.  Yet there is some emotion o her face as she takes a last look at her brother; she tur away.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: Framing him in foreground at the parapet.  Susan can be s through the windows before she disappears to the door. Hunsecker reacts as he catches sight of a vehicle on Broa below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad car comes down Broadway at speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is walking across the square.  The squad car appea in foreground; it pauses hardly at all as Kello slips out it, and starts to move after Sidney.  Then the car accelerates round Duffy Square to cut Sidney off on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney comes up towards CAMERA.  Seeing something ahead, halts...

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD CAR
dialogues.text: From Sidney's viewpoint.  The car breaks to a stop.  It's door opens and a detective gets out slowly.  It is Phil.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sidney is framed in foreground, the squad car beyond. Sidney knows what this means.  He starts to speak before turns to look over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kello, moving silently up behind Sidney, slows down, amus at Sidney's prescience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! (coming to join Sidney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just been on the phone to J.J. Kello's manner is almost affectionate.  He shakes his hea admonishing Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mildly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been a bad boy, Sidney.  J.J.'s going to write about you in his column tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING ACROSS Kello onto Sidney.  Sidney's smile is tir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another thing - he's gonna say you 'resisted arrest'... (as Sidney nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know J.J....! Sidney turns away to look back towards Phil.  Then, takin Kello totally by surprise, he wheels, striking the cop viciously across the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: KELLO
dialogues.text: Kello's head jerks back.  Recovering at once, he guffaws, lurches into CAMERA with a sudden vicious movement.  Ther is a sharp guttural cry over scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil runs forward towards the figures of Sidney and Kello seen beyond him.  In doing so, he blocks the view so that do not clearly see the violence with which Kello strikes Sidney down.  Phil, in foreground, is seen to relax.  Whe he moves aside, clearing the view, Sidney is writhing on ground at Kello's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kello wipes his knuckles on his handkerchief.  He signals Phil to help lift the body at his feet.  Phil enters shot and they raise Sidney, half carrying, half dragging him o of shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops carry the figure of Sidney Falco across Duffy Square; they bundle him into the police car.  The pigeons the square, circle.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER'S TERRACE
dialogues.text: CAMERA LOOKS down towards Duffy Square in the distance. police car can be seen moving off, circling the square an disappearing southward on Broadway.  CAMERA PULLS BACK to include Hunsecker in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: A CLOSE SHOT, SHOOTING sharply upward at Hunsecker.  He looks down, quiet impassively, and there is a slightly insane grandeur, a paranoiac superiority in the way that turns back, dismissing Sidney from his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SHOOTS towards the closed door of Susan's room. Hunsecker walks into the shot, stops before the door.  He begins to take off his tie and unbutton his shirt, clearl preparing to go to bed.  As an after-thought, he comes ba to the door, addresses it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie? (getting no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in bed...? CAMERA MOVES CLOSER.  It is at a low level, still emphasi the man's dignity.  He strolls for a few paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to tell you, of course, that I cleared your boyfriend's name; I didn't let you down... CAMERA has now moved so that we are shooting past Hunseck onto Susan's door.  He gets no answer except silence.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: A CLOSE SHOT, REVERSE ANGLE.  We now see in his face a flicker of fear.  With what is clearly an effort, he reassumes a confident manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was saving this news for breakfast, but I think I'll jump the gun!  I'M GONNA GIVE YOU AND

dialogues.speaker: TOWN HAS EVER SEEN
dialogues.text: Still no answer from inside the bedroom.  Hunsecker's for expression remains unnaturally fixed upon his face.  He calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is quite empty.  CAMERA SHOOTS across the bed towards the door in background.  Susan's discarded fur co lies on the bed.  And the doors of the wardrobe are open. Hunsecker's voice can be heard continuing over scene:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting the Mayor to perform the ceremony and - NO, I think I'll fly the Governor down from Albany... (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear...? A pause.  Then, very tentatively, the bedroom door is ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listening?... Now he opens the door and comes in.

dialogues.speaker: HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: A BIG CLOSE UP.  The sight of the empty room freezes his face for a moment.  His eyes look round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Hunsecker's viewpoint.  A PANNING SHOT, from the ope door of the cupboard to the fur coat.  CAMERA PULLS BACK include Hunsecker.  He steps to the bed, picks up the coa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a dazed, incredulous look on his face.  But, as glances over his shoulder, CAMERA ZOOMS PAST him towards little door in the wall behind him: It is ajar, showing a couple of inches of light.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME HUNSECKER
dialogues.text: Once again Hunsecker reassures himself that Susan must be behind the door.  But his voice is even more false as he declares:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a note of anger appearing in his voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie!...You won't threaten me!...Nobody walks out on J.J. Hunsecker! CAMERA NOW MOVES CLOSER and closer to Hunsecker.  The ANG is a weird one, tilting grotesquely upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need me - you all need me!... Hunsecker, his fists clenching fiercely at the fur coat, walks towards the door.  CAMERA PANS with him.  He stands few inches from the narrow opening.  He seems about to pu the door open further, but is afraid to do so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SHOOTS ACROSS the bathtub, showing enough of the t room to make it clear that it, too, is completely empty. Through the slit in the door, we can see only a glimpse o the movement of Hunsecker outside.  Hunsecker's voice continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Lord is my Shepherd; I shall not want". (a sneering laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bunk in a book!  I'm the Shepherd of millions of little men and women!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOWNWARD ANGLE, SHOOTING past Hunsecker to the door.  A Hunsecker retreats from the door, he is still clutching t fur coat.  He stands alone in the middle of the room and gestures are a little wild.  CAMERA rises higher to shoot down at Hunsecker, alone in the little room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't ask them to get on their knees, but they come to me for advice and guidance!  Who are you to reject me! With an increasingly eccentric manner, Hunsecker strides of the bedroom door into the living room again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A similar ANGLE, SHOOTING down on Hunsecker as he comes o of the bedroom.  But as he starts to roam the vast room, CAMERA rises higher still, pulling backwards and upwards a LONG SHOT which holds the entirety of the big room in a its ugliness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes YOU fit to sit in judgment on a man like me.  Only a great person understands another great person, and that leaves you out! Hunsecker is now addressing the whole of the apartment, n longer pretending even to himself, that the girl is still listening.  He moves off towards the windows to the terra where the curtains are now blowing in the morning wind. goes out towards the terrace, his voice becoming more distant - a man shouting empty nonsense, addressing no on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - That leaves you ALL out!  You're pigmies!  You're all sick, weak midgets!  I'm proud to be alone!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SHOOTS STEEPLY UP towards the top of the Brill Bld (At this angle Hunsecker's terrace will not be visible bu its position is established in relationship to the Budwei sign.) CAMERA PANS DOWN to pick up the figure of Susan Hunsecker as she pushes her way out of the brass doors on Broadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan pauses on the sidewalk.  She stays there for a mome She breathes in the fresh morning air, looking around wit the expression of someone who sees the world with new eye Then she starts up Broadway - away from the Times Square area.  The girl's step has a purpose in it; she has confidence and courage.  Music for the end titles is quie simple and lyrical. END OF PICTURE
